trans-unit.source: Change the DNS registrar for your custom domain name | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Change the DNS registrar for your custom domain name | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Describes how to change the DNS registrar for your custom domain name in Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: Describes how to change the DNS registrar for your custom domain name in Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: What to do if you change the DNS registrar for your custom domain name
trans-unit.target: What to do if you change the DNS registrar for your custom domain name

trans-unit.source: If you only use your custom domain name with Azure AD, then you can continue to use your custom domain name without interruption and without additional configuration tasks in your Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: If you only use your custom domain name with Azure AD, then you can continue to use your custom domain name without interruption and without additional configuration tasks in your Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: If you use your custom domain name with Office 365, Intune, or other services that rely on custom domain names, refer to the documentation for those services.
trans-unit.target: If you use your custom domain name with Office 365, Intune, or other services that rely on custom domain names, refer to the documentation for those services.

trans-unit.source: Using custom domain names to simplify the sign-in experience for your users
trans-unit.target: Using custom domain names to simplify the sign-in experience for your users

trans-unit.target: Add company branding to your Sign In and Access Panel pages

trans-unit.target: Add and verify a custom domain name in Azure Active Directory
